item.title: 2023-06-08T19:21:34
item.description:
Google rolls out 'Emoji Workshop' live wallpaper.

Right now a new update for the 'Emoji workshop wallpaper' app is starting to appear on the Play Store for the Android 14 Beta 3 users. After the update, a new 'Emoji workshop' tile will appear in the wallpaper list after a while.

When you create a wallpaper, you can choose up to 14 emoji to be included in the custom wallpaper, choose one of the patterns: "Mosaic", "Lotus", "Stacks", "Placer", "Prism"; and choose one of the colors. It is also possible to choose a random set.

The app will save several emoji wallpapers you have created in the corresponding section, and you will have the possibility to edit them and also to share the statis variant and turn of its animations.

ðŸ”— Play Store Emoji workshop wallpaper link

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-08T18:18:54
item.description:
You can now create your own "Ð¡inematic photos" in Google Photos.

In December 2020, Google launched a new Google Photos feature that automatically gave your photos a cinematic effect, creating a three-dimensional representation of the scene. A year later, the company updated algorithms so that machine learning filled in parts of the background behind the object.

Until now, however, users had no way of creating cinematic photos themselves. You should have been lucky enough for Google Photos to create a photo with a cinematic effect. But that's about to change.

Under Library/Utilities, there will be a new item called "Cinematic Photo". By opening it you'll be able to create a photo with 3D cinematic effect by yourself from any image in your library. (processing results attached)

*This feature is already being rolled out to some users

*Exclusive of Google One subscription and Pixel devices

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-08T10:03:17
item.description:
Google News app gets new Material You widgets.

Announced as part of the June Android Feature Drop, Google is rolling out an updated widget design along with an app update to version 5.82.

â€¢ The 2x2 "Quick view" widget shows you one particular news story with a "Full coverage" button.
â€¢ The "List view" widget shows you the headlines as a list, with a "More news for you" button at the end to open the "For you" tab.

When you resize, one widget flows into the other, so you don't need to pull out any particular one, just change its occupied space.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T22:48:10
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 3: New shortcuts on the lock screen require a long press.

To activate a configured quick action, you must now tap and hold on the corresponding shortcut. If you just click on it, you will see an animation with haptic feedback and a notification "Touch & hold shortcut".

This is most likely to ensure that you do not activate the action by accident.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T22:04:05
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 3: You can now tap on the clock in the Quick settings to open the Clock app again.

The long-suffering feature that disappeared with the release of Android 12 and was much requested by users is back in the third beta version of Android 14.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T21:16:23
item.description:
A demonstration of all the new lock screen clock options Android 14.

Google has really made an effort, and many of them have a nice animation when switching to Always on Display mode.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T20:46:44
item.description:
New charging connection effect in the status bar.

Android 14 Beta 3 has added a new pop-up chip with battery icon and percentage of charge when connect the charger, the animation is similar to the privacy indicators. The chip only pops up for a short time.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T20:18:45
item.description:
Lock screen Clock and shortcuts customization and Redesigned Wallpaper & style app.

Android 14 Beta 3 brings Google's promised lock screen customization. It's all in order:

â€¢ Holding down on the lock screen will bring up the "Customize lock screen" button at the bottom.

â€¢ Wallpaper and style are now divided into Locked Screen and Home Screen settings.

â€¢ There are 9 clock options to choose from, each adapted to the AOD. You can also choose their color and brightness, as well as whether they are dynamically sized or small (in a single line on the top left).

â€¢ Available lock screen shortcuts include : None, Do not disturb, QR code scanner, Smart home control, Silent, Camera and Flashlight.

â€¢ A selection of lock screen shortcuts options is also available in the locked screen system settings.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-06-07T19:46:26
item.description:
Here are the issues that have been fixed in Android 14 Beta 3:

* Fixed issues that prevented Wi-Fi calling from being enabled for some devices and carriers. (Issue #277964472)
* Fixed an issue that caused Direct My Call interactions to fail in some cases where they would normally work. (Issue #278252154)
* Fixed system issues that caused unnecessary power consumption in some cases.
* Fixed system stability issues that caused UI jank in some cases.
* Fixed an issue that caused the system Settings app to crash while setting the wallpaper.
* Fixed an issue with the system UI that could cause a GPU hang, leading to "Application Not Responding" (ANR) errors.
* Fixed a system issue that could sometimes cause a device's GPS services to stop working until the device was rebooted.
* Fixed issues with the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) that could prevent devices from being able to make Wi-Fi calls in some cases.
* Fixed an issue where a blank screen displays after selecting the "Message" option for a recent caller in the Google Phone app.
* Fixed an issue where while 3-button navigation was enabled for a device, putting Google Maps into picture-in-picture mode made the picture-in-picture window disappear.
* Fixed an issue where locking and unlocking a device while playing a video in the Google TV app could cause the device to freeze.
* Fixed an issue with Android Auto where some users could be asked to re-pair Bluetooth.
* Fixed issues with Health Connect, including the following issues and other API and system behaviors:
* An issue where the system back button stopped working while Health Connect integration was in progress.
* An issue where the Route Permissions screen would sometimes freeze.
* An issue where Health Connect sometimes couldn't be accessed in system settings.
* An issue where the data category page of Health Connect was missing some permission types when a filter was applied.

Here are the known issues with Android 14 Beta 3:

* An issue with the Credential Manager platform APIs causes instability in apps that use them. A fix is available in the latest preview version of the Android 14 SDK, which developers can install using Android Studio. Developers who previously installed a preview version of the Android 14 SDK should completely uninstall the previous version and then reinstall the SDK to apply the fix.
* An issue with the system UI sometimes causes the screen to flicker when a video is playing or an app is using in picture-in-picture mode.
* In some cases, video continues playing in the background even after closing an app if the video was playing in picture-in-picture mode when it was closed.
* A video that is playing in picture-in-picture mode stops playing abruptly if the back gesture is used within the PiP settings screens.
* A system issue can sometimes cause the Android System Intelligence service to crash.
* When using a device with a work profile, the Google Play Store app in the work profile hangs or crashes when launched.

item.title: 2023-06-07T19:44:37
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 3 is out! Pixel 7a is now included in the beta testing program.

With the third beta, Android 14 is entering a milestone of work on platform stability. This means that all of the system's APIs and app-facing behaviour have been finalised. Developers can now publish new builds of their apps targeting SDK34 on Google Play.

Build Number: UPB2.230407.019 â†’ UPB3.230519.008
Security Patch: May 2023

Google has already started distributing the update over the air.

â€¢ OTAs

â€¢ Factory Images

ðŸ”— Register for Android beta testing
